comments: The function sigma = A000203 (and thus A001065 = sigma - id) is defined only on the positive integers and not for 0, so the trajectory ends when 0 is reached. - _M. F. Hasler_, Nov 16 2013
references: R. K. Guy, Unsolved Problems in Number Theory, B6.
Enoch Haga, Exploring Prime Numbers on Your PC, 2nd ed., 1998, pages 83-84 and Table 8, page 46. ISBN 1-885794-16-9.
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..178
formula: a(n) = A001065(a(n-1)) for n>0, thus a(n) = A001065^n(138) for all n<179. - _M. F. Hasler_, Nov 16 2013
maple: f := proc(n) option remember; if n = 0 then 138; else sigma(f(n-1))-f(n-1); fi; end:
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
extensions: Term 179 removed from b-file by _Ivan Panchenko_, Nov 16 2013
